container.heading: Vehicle Registration Suspension and Nonrenewal for Failure to Pay Toll

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter establishes procedures governing the suspension or nonrenewal by the Administration of vehicle registrations for the failure to pay a notice of toll due, pursuant to Transportation Article, §§21-1414 and 27-110, Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
"Authority" means the Maryland Transportation Authority or its designated agent.
"Toll violation" has the meaning stated in Transportation Article, §21-1414(a)(9), Annotated Code of Maryland.
The Administration shall refuse the registration of any motor vehicle incurring a toll violation upon notification from the Authority.
The registered owner of a vehicle shall resolve with the Authority all outstanding toll violations, including fees and fines.
The Administration may renew or transfer the vehicle registration only after the Authority notifies the Administration in accordance with COMAR 11.07.07.08A(1)(b).
The Administration shall suspend the registration of any motor vehicle incurring a toll violation upon notification from the Authority.
The registered owner of a vehicle shall resolve with the Authority all outstanding toll violations, including fees and fines.
The Administration may lift the suspension only after the Authority notifies the Administration in accordance with COMAR 11.07.07.08B(1)(c).

section.heading: Notice of Suspension.
section.text: A notice of a proposed suspension by the Administration of a vehicle registration for failure to pay a toll violation shall:

para.text: Be personally served on the registered owner by U.S. mail sent to the registered owner at the address of the individual on record with the Administration;
State the reason for the suspension; and
Advise the individual that all toll violations must be resolved with the Authority before the suspension may be lifted.
